item.title: Ugly Number II
item.description: Write a program to find the n-th ugly number. Ugly numbers are positive numbers whose prime factors only include 2, 3, 5. Example: Input: n = 10 Output: 12 Explanation: 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 8, 9, 10, 12 is the sequence of the first 10 ugly numbers. Note: 1 is typically treated as an ugly number. n does not exceed 1690. Solution import heapq class Solution: def nthUglyNumber(self, n: int) -> int: if n <= 0: return 0 if n == 1: return 1 q = [1] visited = {1: True} removed = 0 ans = 0 while removed !
